Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.geotess.Data
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataArrayOfBytes, DataArrayOfCustoms, DataArrayOfDoubles, DataArrayOfFloats, DataArrayOfInts, DataArrayOfLongs, DataArrayOfShorts, DataByte, DataCustom, DataDouble, DataFloat, DataInt, DataLong, DataShort
    public abstract class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that manages the data values attached to single grid node in the model. Data objects have no information about the position in the model where the data is located.

    There is no public constructor. Call the constructor of one of the derived classes to obtain an instance.

      Default constructor.

      • getData

        public static Data getData​(gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.DataType dataType,
                           int nAttributes)
        Factory method that will return a Data of the specified DataType with all values initialized to 0. Note: This static method cannot be called directly for DataCustom types as the method has no way of knowing which concrete instance of DataCustom to instantiate. Use the static method defining AttributeDataDefinitions or GeoTessMetaData below instead.
        Parameters:
        dataType - the type of the requested Data object.
        nAttributes -
        Returns:
        a Data object of the correct derived type

      • getData

        public static Data getData​(gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.DataType dataType,
                           GeoTessMetaData metaData)
        Factory method that will return a Data object with all values initialized to 0 given the input GeoTessMetaData object which provides the data specification.
        Parameters:
        dataType - The type of the requested Data object (This is redundant).
        metaData - GeoTessMetaData providing the data specification.
        Returns:
        A Data object of the correct derived type

      • getData

        public static Data getData​(AttributeDataDefinitions attrDef)
        Factory method that will return a Data object with all values initialized to 0 given the input AttributeDataDefinitions object which provides the data specification.
        Parameters:
        attrDef - AttributeDataDefinitions providing the data specification.
        Returns:
        A Data object of the correct derived type

      • getData

        protected static Data getData​(java.util.Scanner input,
                              GeoTessMetaData metaData)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Factory method that will return a Data of the correct derived type as specified by the input GeoTessMetaData object. The data are read from a Scanner object which is assumed to be at the correct position in the underlying ASCII stream.
        Parameters:
        input - The scanner from which the data is read.
        metaData - The GeoTessMetaData object containing the data specification.
        Returns:
        A Data object of the correct derived type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public Data read​(java.util.Scanner input,
                 GeoTessMetaData metaData)
        Read the attribute values for this Data object from the supplied Scanner in ASCII format into this Data object. This method needs to be overridden by a concrete class that handles the specific type read.
        Parameters:
        input - An ASCII Scanner stream containing the input to be read.
        metaData - GeoTessMetaData object describing the data to be read.
        Returns:
        Reference to Data object read from input.

      • read

      • isNaN

        public boolean isNaN​(int attributeIndex)
        Return true if the value of the specified attribute is NaN. Data objects of type byte, short, int and long always return false. Only data objects of type float and double can return true.
        Parameters:
        attributeIndex -
        Returns:
        true if the value of the specified attribute is NaN.
